intro: Dendranthema zawadzkii, commonly known as the Polish daisy, is a flowering plant native to Central and Eastern Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disc florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring basal leaves that are lanceolate and covered in fine hairs. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, producing white to pale yellow petals with a central yellow disk. Dendranthema zawadzkii is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adaptable to a variety of soil types.
